p: We quantify the uncertainties in our nowcast estimates of ILI incidence. In particular, we investigate the effect of “backfill” [ 47] on the forecasting accuracy. ILI incidence values are subject to backfill [ 47] which corresponds to a retroactive revision of ILI data as better and additional data becomes available later. In particular, the initial ILI estimates can be revised by up to ±25%. These revisions can continue for as long as 40 weeks after the publication of the initial estimates before they stabilize [ 47].
